dialogues.text: Mameha looks around, selects a DELIVERY BOY pedalling in street, his bicycle loaded with a towering stack of bundl

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Make him fall over. With one look. Close up: --eyes flash in a hand mirror-- Chiyo hesitates anxiously. Then she sees a solution: A TRUCK is backing slowly out of an alley. In a split-second, Chiyo boldly steps into the street and stares directly into the Delivery Boy’s face as he passes Surprised, the Boy momentarily turns his head -- -- then hears a truck’s HORN. The Boy brakes and swerves The bicycle’s heavy load topples, spilling its driver and cargo across the pavement, Mameha sends Chiyo a wry look. CLOSE UP: ---a tin make-up box slams shut-- MAMEHA (cont ‘d) You are ready.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE OKIYA. NIGHT
dialogues.text: MOTHER and AUNTIE, dressed for the occasion, wait impatie in the entry-way. Mameha flings open the shoji screen of tatami room to reveal: Chiyo, now as flawless and painted as a gorgeous, Japanes doll, in the full make-up of a maiko. Her hair is waxed a shiny black; Mameha’s richly embroidered “butterfly-sleev kimono falls in lush pools of silk at her feet. Chiyo mov across the room and stops at a full length mirror. She stares at herself in the glass. Tears well in her eyes. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chiyo looks to Mameha. Even Bekku’s impressed. *  94 95

dialogues.speaker: 10/20/04 GOLDENROD REVISION .58
dialogues.text: Mother intercedes-— *

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hurry up! You are not making money standing there gawking at yourself--

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Chiyo’s foot as the snowy tabi parts and the tho of her shoe slides between. the gloved toes. Chiyo walks down the path on her tall maiko shoes and pau under the lantern, in the same spot where she first laid on Hatsumomo. Behind her Auntie strikes the flint.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE
dialogues.text: For luck. SPARKS fly behind Chiyo.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEHIND YUKIMOTO TEAHOUSE. SUNSET.
dialogues.text: In the garden, Mameha and Chiyo exchange three cups of sa (served by the teahouse-owner) in a “sisters” ritual. Mot and Auntie stand in attendance.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: This binds us together forever as sisters. Today you leave your childhood and cast away your name. From this day forward, you will be known by a new one...with the same lilt, the same music as the water you resemble... (a pause, and then) .--"Sayuri.” Sayuri, formerly Chiyo, bows her head in gratitude.  96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEAHOUSE OWNER--teetering with a tray stacked with sa and beer--barrels down the deep red hallway toward the te room. LAUGHTER and conversation spill from the room as sh flings open the shoji doors. EIGHT MEN are seatled in conversational groups at low tab around three sides of the room. In the seat of honor, we recognize The Baron. The OTHER MEN are mostly older and a wealthy, their spirits loosened by sake. The host, Hatsumomo's favorite client THE GENERAL (55, chainsmoker) wears a Japanese military uniform. TWO GEISHA move gracefully among the tables, serving sake they chat among the men. Behind a screen, before they make their entrance:

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Tonight, you will attend the Baron. CHIYO looks at her, uncertain. Isn‘t he Mameha‘s territor MAMEHA (cont'd) A new maiko always attends the honored guest. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Onei-san, thank you. Mameha smiles. They enter,, bowing on the floor, murmuring their greetin etc. ‘Then they hurry toward the Baron with small steps. General lifts his sake cup:

dialogues.speaker: THE GENERAL
dialogues.text: Friends, we have the pleasure to witness the debut of a new maiko. Some of the men applaud, and all lift their glasses. With guick small steps that make her kimono hem ripple, Sayuri approaches The Baron and kneels, blushing. The Baron eyes her playfully, admiring. To Mameha:

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: I remember those eyes. What was her name? Mameha looks to Sayuri, giving her permission to respond. Sayuri feels a pang of pleasure as she speaks the word:  97 60

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: “Sayuri”.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEBA
dialogues.text: (whisper) You may replenish the Baron’s tea. Sayuri self-consciously takes up the teapot. She aims the spout low, close to the Baron’s cup, so the aroma doesn’t escape. Meanwhile-- with the other hand--she draws back h kimono sleeve, exposing her wrist, pausing exactly as Mam has taught her. The Baron’s eyes drift to Sayuri’s arm. After a few secon have elapsed, Sayuri is mortified to realize that the Bar cup is still empty -- no tea is pouring from the spout of depleted tea pot.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: She’s determined, isn’t she? If there’d been a drop of tea in that pot, I believe Sayuri would have gotten it out-- Everyone laughs. Under her make-up, Sayuri is flushed wit embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Now don’t tease, Baron. It's her very first time.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Mameha’‘s fingers pluck the strings of her shamisen, accompanying Sayuri. Sayuri gracefully dances with two fans, just as Mameha ta her. As Sayuri dramatically tosses and catches one of the fans, she sees: The Teahouse Owner leading in Hatsumomo and Pumpkin. Hatsumomo seductively advances on the Baron’s table, Pump in tow.

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: Baron...Forgive me for intruding - General Tottori was good enough to ask us to call. The General, tipsy, has no memory of it but he is pleased fill her cup with sake. Sayuri and Mameha end the dance, the men applaud.  61 HATSUMOMO (cont ‘d) What a beautiful dance! Yes, Pumpkin? Deftly, Hatsumomo takes a fan from Pumpkin and demonstrat HATSUMOMO (cont ‘d) Her fans are so hypnotic that you never ndtice her feet. (turns to Sayuri) What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Her name is Sayuri.

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: “Sayuri” - a name as sweet as she is! (to the General) I‘m afraid these days, even a common chambermaid can call herself a geisha. {her eyes narrowing in Sayuri's direction) So it's nice to see such a sincere young maiko. Isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: THE GENERAL
dialogues.text: (caught in the middle, stammering) Why, yes. Indeed.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (to Sayuri) Surely you would like to thank Hatsumomo for her gracious compliments.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: There is so much I would like to say to Hatsumomo.

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: Sometimes, the wisest remark is to say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What better advice to follow than your own?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Sayuri--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 62 Sayuri bows low to Hatsumomo.

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: I was a maiko myself once.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Of course. But it’s been such a very long, long, long, long... The Baron and the men laugh. Sayuri continues demurely: SAYURI (cont‘d) ---time. Hatsumomo bridles.

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: Little Sayuri has studied to be a geisha for such a short time, she hasn‘t learned her manners. (to the General) Tell me. Would you ever send a man into battle before he's ready?

dialogues.speaker: THE GENERAL
dialogues.text: Never. My men are trained to kill.

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: (to Mameha) Perhaps her debut came too soon.

dialogues.speaker: THE GENERAL
dialogues.text: {stifling laughter) On the contrary, Hatsumomo....I'd say...I'd say she hit her target!... The Baron laughs, too, and the laughter grows, filling th room. Hastumomo glares, ashen. Pumpkin bites her lip to k from grinning. Mameha smiles at how her protege has handl herself. Sayuri bears the peaceful look of triumph. cur TO: INT: SAYURI‘S ROOM. THE OKIYA. NIGHT/DAWN. [WINTER] 98 Abrupt awakening: Hatsumomo jerks Sayuri awake by the hai and slaps her. In a quiet rage, she whispers:

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: I shall destroy you.  99 100 63 With another vicious yank, Hatsumomo leaves her.

dialogues.speaker: QUTSIDE OF MIYAKO. DAY.
dialogues.text: Shaded by a colorful parasol, Mameha and Sayuri ride in A RICKSHAW past an ornate pagoda; Sayuri in full maiko atti and make-up.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: She can destroy you. She will spread rumors, stalk you from tea- house to tea-house, then steal your clients and turn them over to Pumpkin! All in the hope that Mrs. Nitta adopts Pumpkin instead of you!

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What can we do?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: We've got to out-wit her. To find a safe haven...somewhere beyond her reach, where you can practice your skills without any interference. And I’ve found just the place. (gives her a card) Your first sumo match.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (nodding) It is sold out. Hatsumomo could not gain admission if she were a rat and scurried under the seats. SAYURI smiles, her appetite whetted. MAMEHA (cont'd) Today you will meet Iwamura Ken. He founded the Iwamura Electric Company in Osaka. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: 12/9/04 DOUBLE PINK REVISION 64
dialogues.text: MAMEHA (cont'd) My client for years. His partner Nobu...well, they say what he lacks in charm, he makes up for in savvy--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: You don't approve of Nobu?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: He does npt approve of us. * Off Sayuri’s dismayed look: MAMEHA (cont'd) You like a challenge, don't you? Mameha laughs merrily, as the RICKSHAW passes over a grac bridge in the Japanese countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suspended over the mounded dohyo (clay sumo ring) is a ro resembling a,Shinto shrine, and hung at the corners with giant colored tassels honoring the four season. All aroun the ring rise tiers of boxes filled with kneeling SPECTAT In the ring, two almost naked rikishi (FIRST PAIR OF SUMO WRESTLERS) are already in combat as Mameha and Sayuri mak their way to the first tier boxes .~ As Sayuri and Mameha approach the box where their clients wait, MEN turn their heads, looking to see which box will receive the honor of two such beautiful geishas.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEBA
dialogues.text: (whispers) Be attentive. i will do the rest. Sayuri follows Mameha nervously toward two men seated ina first tier box. Sayuri realizes that one of the two men seems somehow familiar. He rises and greets Mameha warmly It is The Chairman. Sayuri’s heart is pounding as she bow MAMEHA (cont'd) Chairman Iwamura, President Nobu, * this is my new younger sister Sayuri.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURIT
dialogues.text: Hajimemashite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sayuri gazes momentously into the face she has longed see, the Chairman abruptly averts his eyes, and speaks instead to NOBU:

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Nobu-san. NOBU (42, strong presence of power and intelligence) ‘is focused on the match. He cries out the name of the wrestl whom he sponsors ("Tochinoyama!”), then berates him in Japanese. The Chairman tries again: CHAIRMAN (cont’d) Nobul When Nobu turns to greet Sayuri, she feels a slight shock Nobu's face is disfigured, badly scarred on one side; his right hand is a web of puckered scars. Mameha deftly make the introduction --

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Nobu Toshikazu-san. Nobu gives a shout as THE SECOND SET OF WRESTLERS mount t ring. Mameha seats Sayuri between the Chairman and Nobu, manages to whisper in Sayuri’s ear: MAMEHA (cont'd) Injured in Manchuria. War hero.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Sayuri, is this your first encounter with sumo? Sayuri nods, too nervous to speak. She is aware of how cl they sit, her leg and his almost touching as they kneel. CHAIRMAN (cont’d)} Nobu-san will have to educate you. I cannot tell one wrestler from the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAIRMAN (cont'd) (gestures around tent) Did you notice our contribution? Mameha notices the electric lights, gives a delighted cry

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Lovely! The CHAIRMAN turns to Sayuri:

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: We closed a new deal in the countryside. We're harnessing the power of water to bring electricity to some of the smaller villages.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: It was in the newspaper, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: With the Chairman's picture, yes? (teasing his friend) You compensate for all my shortcomings, don't you? A RUNNER delivers a pot of tea and cups. Sayuri takes up pot to pour the Chairman his tea. She draws back her slee and breaks the silence:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: May I ask: How does someone harness the power of water? The Chairman glances at Sayuri's wrist, then meets her ga evenly--

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: You should never ask an engineer to explain a thing. Because he will--

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Iwamura. Let the girl watch sumo! Sayuri, teapot in mid-air, freezes, her gaze riveted: Acr the ring, Hatsumomo is arriving with Korin.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Korin, that little jade! She has brought a guest. They see: Hatsumomo looks through opera glasses at the Chairman. Mameha raises her fan for a private tete-a-tete with Sayuri: MAMEHA (cont ‘d) Quick, Turn your attention to Nobu--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (with dread) But Mameha-neisan--

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (rapid-fire) She finds him repulsive. She’d never steal him away. Mislead her. Mameha lowers her fan. Instantly Sayuri shifts the teapot Nobu's cup. The Chairman's face falls, but he works to conceal his disappointment. Sayuri improvises:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Perhaps Nobu-san will be kind enough to explain the rules of the match. The Chairman glances into his cup; it’s only half full. Mameha swoops in, pouring the rest of his tea.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Three things matter in life: Sumo, business and war. Understand one, you know them all. But why should a geisha care? You spend your time plucking strings, and dancing. Nobu turns away, scowling; sips his tea. Sayuri senses Hatsumomo watching. She redoubles her efforts.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I humbly beg to differ. What is sumo but a dance between giants? What is business but a dance between companies? (beat) I‘d@ like to know about every kind of dance.

dialogues.speaker: 12/9/04 DOUBLE PINK REVISION 68
dialogues.text: The Chairman smiles, impressed. Nobu begrudgingly begins pointing out elements of the match:

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Shiomaki...They are throwing salt to purify the ring. The two combatants quickly move from their “fair play sta to a glowering crouth as they face off in the small ring. NOBU (cont ‘d) That man is Miyagiyama. The greatest fighter in Japan.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: But he is so tiny--

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Only compared to his opponent! Miyagiyama may use hataki komi--- are you listening? Sayuri has one eye on The Chairman, but quickly reforms:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Hataki komi is a movement a smaller combatant uses to throw the larger man off balance. Victory does not always belong to the powerful-- Nobu watches intently as the Wrestlers prepare and throw salt, prepare again, building tension. He points brusquel NOBU (cont’d) Look. There. In his eyes. The Wrestlers tense and prepare to charge. At the same ti Mameha sees: Hatsumomo has left her seat and is making he way toward them. Mameha gathers herself apologetically:

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: I am afraid our time has come to a close--

dialogues.speaker: CHATRMAN
dialogues.text: Going sc soon?  102 69

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Not yet--I want her to see-- The Wrestlers crouch on their fists. Finally the larger m SAIHO, charges. MILYAGIYAMA uses the force of Saiho'’s impact to swivel o the way. In that same instant, he brings his hand down on the back of Saiho's neck; Saiho flies over the lip of the ring and sprawls into the SPECTATORS. The encounter is ov in less than two seconds. NOBU (cont ‘d) Now that - is hataki komi.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I see now why you like Sumo. (with compassion for Nobu 's: deformities) You can never judge a man’s power by his appearance alone. Nobu looks at Sayuri--full on--for the first time. He’s truly touched by her insight. He says to Mameha:

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: You may bring her again.

dialogues.speaker: A SHORT TIME LATER 102
dialogues.text: Sayuri & Mameha leave the match, among a press of SPECTAT

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What are we to do? Hatsumomo found us again!

dialogues.speaker: MAMERA
dialogues.text: Do not worry. Like a true sumo wrestler, you threw her off balance! Nobu is the perfect diversion. Sayuri peeks back at Chairman. Only Nobu watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (worried) Suppose he believes my advances...suppose he takes an interest in me?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: And violates all his high-minded morals? Never.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: But Oneisan...you heard him. He asked to see me again.

dialogues.speaker: ' MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (musing) Yes....he did, didn’t he? (back to business) In the days ahead, Sayuri, I am going to require all your trust. I have it, don’t I? Sayuri nods. MAMEHA (cont'd) Good! Then our only enemy is time. 70 CcuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sayuri digs through a stack of old newspapers near the st She tears one open and finds: A BLACK & WHITE PHOTOGRAPH the Chairman. INT.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI'S ROOM. NIGHT.
dialogues.text: Alone, Sayuri uses a hair ornament to pry out the false bottom of a lacquered box. In the compartment, she places the news photo of the Chairman next to the same handkerch he gave her so many years ago. cuT TO: EXT. NEAR MAMEHA’S APT. DAY. [SPRING] Sayuri hastens over the Sonogawa footbridge. from her balcony. Mameha watches 103 104 105  106

dialogues.speaker: 10/12/04 BLUE REVISION 71
dialogues.text: INT. MAMEHA‘S APARTMENT. DAY. [SPRING] 106 Mameha uses the tiny blade of a folding knife to open the seam of a beautiful maiko kimono. The MAID ushers Sayuri in, then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI '
dialogues.text: Onei-san.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Tonight, we will deliver a quick blow to Hatsumomo. Hataki komi.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: How? Mameha drapes the kimono on Sayuri and checks the split s against Sayuri’s right leg.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: We will meet Nobu-san at the Tsunashima restaraunt. But * first....a visit to Dr. Crab! Mameha ‘pinches the end of a smouldering charcoal pencil

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Dr. Crab? Mameha pulls up Sayuri’s kimono exposing her leg. SAYURI (cont'd) Onei-san!

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Hold still. It’s a little nickname he has earned over the years. Mameha pokes her eyebrow charcoal into the slit to mark Sayuri’s leg. Sayuri looks on bewildered. MAMEHA (cont'd) Now cut your leg where I've marked it.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (shocked) What?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEBRA
dialogues.text: Or I will cut it for you.  107 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onei-san...have you gone mad?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (suddenly, harshly) Do you trust me, or don’t you? Well? Mameha’s dead seridus. Sayuri picks up the knife, her fac study in perplexion.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Couldn't I just pretend to have a stomach ache?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Go ahead! Do it! Sayuri swallows hard, then presses the blade against the charcoal mark on her thigh. She gives a gasp of pain. Mam says, almost with a lilt: . MAMEHA (cont ‘d) And now we go fishing for a certain Crab... INT. DR. CRAB’S CLINIC & HOME. HANAMACHI. DAY. [SPRING] 1 DR. CRAB (45, odd, meticulous) wears a metal head reflect

dialogues.speaker: DR. CRAB
dialogues.text: Careless with the sewing scissors, were you? Mortified, Sayuri lies on the examining table under a gha clinical light. She wears the kimono Mameha prepared for her, opened to expose her pale thigh. DR. CRAB (cont‘d) Right through your beautiful kimono...Pity. He inserts his forefinger through the slit and wiggles it his finger grazing Sayuri’s skin.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: It won’t leave a scar, will it? Sayuri is a special girl at a very special time in her life. Dr. Crab instantly understands the allusion, of course.  108 109

dialogues.speaker: DR. CRAB
dialogues.text: With those eyes, you must be quite a commodity. He examines the cut, bringing his face close to her leg. DR. CRAB (cont’d) A clean cut. Won’t leave a mark, I promise. But I‘d best prescribe a bit of antiseptic-- He smiles down at Sayuri as his fingers massage some salv a circular fashion all around the tiny red wound.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Open-air verandas adjoin, decorated with glowing lanterns On the lower veranda, Hatsumomo attends the General and h MILITARY CRONIES. She displays Pumpkin to them like a chi doll. The CAMERA moves on & we see: On the next veranda, Nobu, Chairman and BUSINESSMEN chat amongst themselves. Wrapped in fur-trimmed cloaks over their kimono, Mameha a Sayuri prepare to enter. Mameha shows Sayuri a tiny origa box that opens--like a blooming flower--to reveal a SWEET RICE CAKE with a dab of red.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Ekubo. At the right moment, slip it to Nobu. Discreetly.. (at her puzzled look) He will know what it means. The MAIDS bring in trays. Sayuri and Mameha follow them i kimono hems ruffling in a liquid flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a fleeting moment, Sayuri and the Chairman lock eyes; skirts past him. The Chairman smiles as Mameha bows: MAMEHA (cont'd) Konbanwa. At the General's table, Hatsumomo watches, amused, as Say obediently hurries to Nobu’s side. Nobu extends his sake to Sayuri impatiently. . Il ‘

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: You have kept us waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Please forgive us, Nobu-san. With an apologetic smile, Sayuri quickly takes up his bot Sayuri sees: Hatsumomo, spilling gossip into the General’ ear. In response, the General glances over at Nobu and laughs. Then he whispers the gossip to the person next to him. Soon, the scuttlebutt is circling the table. Sayuri realizes--with a jolt--that Nobu is speaking to he

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: The Chairman thinks I should take more pleasure in life...music, and the theater! What is your impression? The Chairman looks to Sayuri, curious to hear her answer.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: It is useless to push a cart sideways. The Businessmen laugh. Sayuri blushes, amends: SAYURI (cont'd) One could not wish Nobu-san to be anyone but Nobu-san.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: I could not agree more. He extends his cup to Nobu warmly. CHAIRMAN (cont‘d) I owe this man everything. Kampai.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Kampai.  2

dialogues.speaker: 10/27/04 SALMON REVISION
dialogues.text: The men drink.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: --He gives me too much credit, as usual--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chairman smiles at Nobu’s modesty. A maid brings in a tray of fresh sake, and places it on t table. Nobu produces a small box wrapped in silk. He unwraps it, and hands it to Sayuri. t NOBU (cont’d) (downplaying the gift) It’s a trinket. I found it a few days ago. An awkward silence. Sayuri, The Chairman and Mameha are a speechless. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Why, Nobu. I had no idea you were so sentimental.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Call it my new leaf. The Chairman is quietly stunned. Sayuri glances at Mameha, uncertain how to respond. Mameh gives a signal nod: Thank him. Sayuri bows, blushing:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Arigato gozaimasu.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: My mother...she used to wear something similar. Nobu lifts the lid of the box: A simple but elegant COMB. Sayuri just stares at it. NOBU (cont'd) You do not like it?  110

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Forgive me, I have never received a present before. A most unwelcome Hatsumomo appears, Pumpkin at her heels, route to another affair:

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO '
dialogues.text: Konbonwa. * (She notices Nobu‘s gift) * Ah, what a beautiful comb! * Kneeling, she takes the comb from the box and--with a surgeon’s precision--places the comb in Sayuri’s hair. HATSUMOMO (cont'd) Such a joyous moment, Sayuri! (with a glance at Nobu, * and then to Sayuri) * You are finally getting what you deserve. As Hatsumomo steps away, Sayuri lifts her gaze in time to catch the Chairman's guarded expression.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: How lovely. Hatsumomo and Pumpkin bow before leaving:

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO
dialogues.text: And now will you excuse us, please? * We have another engagement. * (to Mameha) * Many, in fact. * (as they leave) * Pumpkin! * And--like a sudden tsunami--they vanish. Discreetly, Mame produces from her sleeve the origami box: The mizuage cak Bowing to Nobu, Sayuri covertly slips the box into his unscarred hand. Flustered, Nobu covers it with his scarre hand at once. Chairman intuits what has happened, looks away. Sayuri whispers:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: You are most kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mameha hurries along, Sayuri tries to keep up. She looks miserable, but Mameha is elated:  77

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: Now-- (hands her origami box) --give this one to Dr. Crab. Sayuri takes the box, but blurts:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Mameha, please’!

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (surprised) You’re upset.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I want to trust you, I do! But you have to tell me what's going on--

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: (her voice rising in defense) I am ensuring your future--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: But tell me how! TI beg you! | J They step up into a rickshaw. Mameha explains:

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: I am trying to orchestrate a bidding war.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Your most precious attribute.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: And what is that?

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Your mizuage. The rickshaw pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: } Riding along in the rickshaw.

dialogues.speaker: COVERED WALKWAY
dialogues.text: The rickshaw pulls away in the backround as Mameha leads Sayuri briskly down a covered walkway. MAMEHA (cont'd) When. you sjip the rice cake to Dr. Crab it is a sign that says your mizuage is ripe for sale. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mameha and Sayuri arrive at the entrance door. The TEA HO OWNER (female, 60, sophisticated) stops them:

dialogues.speaker: TEAHOUSE OWNER
dialogues.text: fhe Doctor has no desire to see you tonight. - Or any night. Her sharp black eyes go to Sayuri accusingly and she shut the door. Mameha and Sayuri exchange a devastated look wh says: “Hatsumomo; who else?”

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: As Sayuri approaches, she hears Hatsumomo berating Pumpki

dialogues.speaker: HATSUMOMO'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I spent the whole night sipping sake and beer--I need food, Pumpkin! Noodles! Something! Go out and fetch it now! Pumpkin stumbles down the steep tansu steps, harried. She draws up short at the sight of Sayuri and chokes back sob Sayuri touches her but she pushes past:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Pumpkin...Pumpkin...

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: I am not supposed to speak to you--  80

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Hatsumomo can not treat you this way--

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: --she can treat me however she chooses-- Pumpkin groans inf frustration; her sandal thong has brok Sayuri quietly takes it from her to repair it:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Why can’t we speak, Pumpkin? You were my first friend in the world--

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Our lives have changed now.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Hatsumomo went to see Dr. Crab, yes?

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: chiyo- chan, I have to go--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (more pointedly now) Didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: I do not know-~-

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Of course you know--you shadow her every step--

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: --if she did, would I tell you?--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: --if you still care for me--

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: --you expect me to betray my big sister?--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: --has she made you cruel, too--

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (faltering) --no--  81

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: My Pumpkin always told the truth--

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: --but--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: --the truth!--- Pumpkin fights her tears and finally breaks. She pulls Sayuri into the dirt corridor of the okiya:

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Tonight...We went to the Tanizato to see Dr. Crab! I sat outside, but I could still hear through the screen. Hatsumomo-neisan said to him, “I live in the same okiya as Sayuri!” His eyes got big, and he said “Really? Tell me everything about her!” And she said, “Oh, sir, I mustn’t! It would only curl your toes!” That made him even More curious. “Well,” said Hatsumomo-neisan, as smooth as silk, “Did you know that she brings men back to her room?” “No!” he cried. “Common sailors, and fishermen, too,” said Hatsumomo- neisan. And the Doctor looked queasy, like he didn’t want to hear anymore. But she kept going. “At all hours, of the night, like an alleycat!.” And then the doctor got very quiet, and stared for the longest time at his hands. And Hatsumomo-neisan said, “What‘’s the matter? Have I told you more than you wanted to know?” Sayuri understands everything now. PUMPKIN (cont'd) I wanted to say something but how could I, Chiyo-chan, how? (then, still wincing) Am I really like her? Am I?

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Is Mameha-san cruel to you, too?  114

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: No. She’s so kind to me, Pumpkin. But sometimes I worry she’s taking me further from the things I want. Sayuri helps her slip on the mended sandal.

dialogues.speaker: ' PUMPRIN
dialogues.text: That man, Nobu. (wrinkling her nose) Do you really like him?

dialogues.speaker: SAYURT
dialogues.text: (sadly) No.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: That‘s what I thought. Do you like someone else? 82 Sayuri looks at Pumpkin; does she know? Sayuri blushes, a rises to leave: PUMPKIN (cont'd) Don’t worry about me, Chiyo-chan. I'll be fine. Better than fine. (beat) Mother plans to adopt me. ‘So my dream of having someplace to live out my life may come true. Jhah- ne! . Pumpkin hugs Sayuri then rushes out. Sayuri is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk, Mameha and Sayuri talk in low tones:

dialogues.text: --TRUCK WHEELS turn as JAPANESE MILITARY TRUCKS cross the bridge into the Hanamachi. JAPANESE SOLDIERS unload and disperse, begin pounding on doors of okiyas. A TRUCK fitt with a loudspeaker cruises by:

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK LOUDSPEAKER
dialogues.text: “This sector is to be evacuated, everyone mist leave. - This district is closed by official order. Please cooperate...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teahouse lanterns are extinguished. Theatre posters p on the long wall where GEISHA huddle in clusters, belongi heaped around them. SOLDIERS patrol as the geisha wait. MILITARY TRUCKS arrive. SOLDIERS herd a group of frighten geisha into the back compartment. They toss aside the geishas‘ belongings - not enough room in the truck. KORIN fights to be allowed onto the truck. Chairman steps down from a truck and pays the Soldier -- has bribed his way into the Hanamachi. Chairman strides off, followed at a respectful distance by an ELDERLY SERV Chairman walks past GEISHA huddied on the ground, wrapped quilts and finery. Some geisha cook over tiny fires. OTHERS sell their finery to each other. Money changes han Chairman keeps searching.  d)

dialogues.speaker: 1/3/05 DOUBLE GREEN REVISION 103A
dialogues.text: The SOUND OF MORE BOMBERS passing overhead. Sayuri, consoling Mameha, looks up to see the Chairman striding toward them. Mameha gives a relieved cry:  104

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Chairman! They are sending us away, but they won‘t say where--

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Osaka, to work in the factories. But you must not go. The city is a prime target; they have already bombed the train station. Get your things, quickly. Sayuri & Mameha take their bundles. Sayuri grabs her shamisen. The Chairman leads them toward rickshaws: CHAIRMAN (cont’d) Nobu and I are trying to find safe havens for as many of you as we can. Here — He passes Mameha to a DRIVER and hands her a certificate CHAIRMAN (cont‘d) - Work certificate. Nurse's aid in Wadayama. Best I could do. Friend of mine is Chief Surgeon there. Hurry! (to RICKSHAW DRIVER) Take care of her. The Rickshaw Driver assists Mameha into his rickshaw. Mam realizes that she and Sayuri are to be separated:

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Sayuri-chan! I will write to you!

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Oneisan! Chairman has handed Sayuri’s bundle to the Elderly Servan

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: This is Arima; he will take you into the hills. Nobu has got a friend there; a kimono-maker. He is sewing parachutes now. (gives her certificate) Anyone stops you, show them this.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Do I have to go?

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: It’s remote, you will be safe---  138 139 140 141 142

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What about you? You said Osaka was dangerous---

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Our factory's there. I have no choice. (then) : I will express your gratitude to Nebu-san. Her gaze is locked on his as her rickshaw pulis away. SAYURI‘S VOICE Because I had endured starvation and hard work before, I knew I could survive.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: omit

dialogues.speaker: THE OMINOUS REFLECTION OF AIRPLANES IN DARK WATER
dialogues.text: The water ripples in their trembling wake. SAYURI'S VOICE {CONT‘D) But for what purpose? The war was so devastating, so brutal. We weren’t merely defeated...we were destroyed. Whole cities evaporating in clouds of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: 1/3/05 DOUBLE GREEN REVISION 106
dialogues.text: An inky red liquid the color of BLOOD begins to course through the water's current, billowing in sanguine clouds SAYURI‘S VOICE (cont'd) The people I knew...after years of blood-shed, what terrible fates had befallen them? We follow the bloodish liquid down its watery path...wher will it take us? Toward some terrible carnage? SAYURI‘S VOICE (cont'd) Most of all, the Chairman. Now, we see the source of the tincture: long bolts of clo newly dyed, unfurled in the water like floating banners. SAYURI'S VOICE (cont‘d) Was he even alive? And if s50...would he even remember? I thought of my old life as a geisha in the Hanamachi. It felt as remote--as hazy--as a dream. Standing knee-deep in a river, her clothing rolled to her waist, a PEASANT WOMAN: we barely recognize that it’s Say The Kimono maker ARASHINO (middle-aged, weathered, kind) oversees as she and a host of OTHER WORKERS rinse their textiles.

dialogues.speaker: ARASHINO
dialogues.text: When you’ve finished, you can string it up to dry, along with the others. Sayuri raises her hands from the stream; her skin is stai with dye.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Near the RIVER: Tail bamboo poles suspend billowing “pray flags" of drying kimono fabric. Among OTHER WORKERS, Sayu hangs the fabric. A YOUTH hurries to her, calling -

dialogues.speaker: YOUTH
dialogues.text: Sayuri. A man from Osaka has come te see you. Sayuri drops her work and pushes through the wilderness o fluttering silk panels. As she hastens, she pulls a peasant’s scarf off and tries to neaten her hair. id +e 143

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her heart in her throat, Sayuri sees a man in a fedora ma his way toward her through the luminescent banners of sil She believes for a moment it is the Chairman. The silk lifts, and her heart falls: The man is Nobu.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Nobu and Sayuri wander among the siik banners:

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: General Tottori was captured, and tried ad a war’ criminal. The Baron lost his fortune and committed suicide-—

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What about the okiya?

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Mr. Bekku is gone, but the others--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Auntie and Mother?

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: (with a smile) --indestructible as always. Sayuri summmons the courage to ask the foremost question hex mind.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: And the Chairman?

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: As well as can be expected. From his pocket, Nobu takes a tiny shard of concrete rubb NOBU (cont'd) This is all that remains of our factories. She touches him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I am so sorry, Nobu-san.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Sayuri, We want to rebuild. But to * do that, we will need your help.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Somewhere under those rags...are you still the greatest geisha in Miyako? ° Sayuri hides her stained hands,

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: {with a rueful laugh) If a tree has no leaves or branches, can you still call it a tree?

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: With nothing but rubble at my feet, can I still call myself a business man? 108 He takes her work-worn hand in his, noticing its roughene and patchy stains. NOBU (cont'd) I should have taken better care of you.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Please. You saved my life. I owe you so much in return. : He gives her hand an affectionate squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: The Chairman and I need American financing. There's a man-~a . certain Colonel] Derricks--who has the power to grant us a contract. I showed him your picture. He requested to meet you. ee eR  o>~ Ww 145

dialogues.speaker: 1/3/05 DOUBLE GREEN REVISION 109
dialogues.text: He looks at her, imploringly. * NOBU (cont ’d)} I am not a persuasive man, Sayuri. But...if you and a few geisha would * once again put on your kimono and join us--we could show the * Anhericans how hospitable our * country can be-- *

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (with longing) How I wish, Nobu-san! But -that was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: I have no doubt, Sayuri, that you could still melt the heart of any man, ho matter how resistant. This slightly bald confession gives Sayuri pause; she doe want to encourage Nobu. NOBU (cont'd) I am not accustomed to begging. But please know that--if you consent--the Chairman and I would be most grateful. Just his name exerts its inexorable pull. SAYURI’s torn. What should she do?

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Dressed in peasant work trousers, her hair in a long tail carrying a very small bundle, Sayuri crosses the bridge i the Hanamachi, past the Shinto shrine. She is stunned to a world utterly transformed and corrupted:  146 147 110 On the main street, SOUVENIR SHOPS selling tea sets and c cotton kimono: “KIMONO $$20$$". AMERICAN flags are plaste everywhere; American JEEPS clog the streets. A RESTAURANT touts “HAM BURGER”. At a shop, WOMEN stamp a “geisha face on scores of identical plaster dolls in paper kimono. Clusters of AMERICAN G.I.s in “civvies” weave down the st - they are drunk in broad daylight. The G.I.s shout at Sayuri, overly-friendly: DRUNKEN G.I. Hey, Mama-san! Where ya going? etc Sayuri evades by ducking into an alley. She emerges at:

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: AMERICAN G.I.s stand in a long queue, watched by MPs unde signs: “1 CHIT PER G.I.” “YOU MUST ACCEPT THE GIRL YOU AR ASSIGNED.” At the entry, Sayuri sees: JAPANESE PROSTITUTES in cheap kimono greet the G.I.s. MAMEHA’S VOICE Tell Nobu there are so few genuine geisha left in Miyako! INT: MAMEHA’S APARTMENT. DAY. [AUTUMN] 147 Mameha’s place is run-down; divided by makeshift curtains into small rooms. Mameha is elegant even in a cotton kimo with a frayed white collar; but she has a shattered quali now; a fragility Sayuri has not seen before.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only “geesha girls"! Every hooker with a painted face and a silk kimono says she’s one of us! No one can tell the difference anymore!

dialogues.speaker: SAYURL
dialogues.text: All the more reason for us to oblige him--

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: To show them the truth of who we are--not the common women they believe us to be--  111

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Sayuri...when my poor Baron filled his pockets with stone...I was desperate. What could I do? I sold my kimono. I traded my jade combs for rations. It was painful at first, but I have made my peace. A FEMALE BOARDER carries' HER BABY through the room, en r to the street. When she’s out of ear-shot, Mameha continu MAMEHA (cont'd) Now I make a small but tidy living, renting rooms. I am not about to start chasing the past--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: It might do you good.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: To remind you that--once with a single glance--you could bring a man like the Baron to his knees. Mameha‘s conviction falters. She’s tempted now.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: Well...I did keep one kimono. Sayuri looks up, hopeful. Mameha rummages among her thing and takes out an ornate kimono box: MAMEHA (cont'd) The Baron gave it to me, when he became my danna. They reverently caress the fabrics: Gorgeous relics of a now lost. Saruyi‘s eyes brim with gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Thank-you, O-neisan.

dialogues.speaker: MAMEHA
dialogues.text: So tell me. What do we know about entertaining Americans?

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Across JAPANESE POSTERS are plastered U.S.O. canteen announcements and G.I. graffiti: “KILROY WAS HERE”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare-chested AMERICAN G.I.s in boxer shorts and dog-tags spill out of a tea room, laughing. Drunken SERVICE MEN clumsily dance with fans to a RECORD PLAYER’s American pop music. One GI strums a shamisen as it were a guitar. PUMPKIN, in a garish kimono with dog ta around her neck and an officer's cap on her head, “teache them, laughing and flirting and smoking a cigarette betwe her teeth. A G.I. kisses Pumpkin on the mouth. Pumpkin sees a peasan girl watching from the corridor: The peasant girl is Sayuri.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (with a squeal) Chiyo? Hey, Chiyo-chan! Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT
dialogues.text: Broken-hearted Japanese music whines. Wedged at a tiny noodle bar, Pumpkin slurps her soup and smokes at the sam time. STEAM rises from pots, half-obscuring PEOPLE waitin behind them: WORKING CLASS JAPANESE and a few AMERICAN GI

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I have no right to ask favors of you, Pumpkin. I know that-- PUMPKIN ignores Sayuri‘s remark, and says blithely:

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Guess what? I only smoke Chesterfields now.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I have wanted to apologize to you for so long-- about the okiya--  113

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (still ignoring her) These soldier-boys, you know who they've got me singing--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: --it should have gone to you, not me-- ! ‘

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: --Frank Sinatra, and Dinah Shore--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: --if it is in your heart to forgive me-~

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (abruptly) Sayuri, don’t. Pumpkin looks at Sayuri. Underneath her tough demeanor, Sayuri can still see the impish spirit of her old friend. PUMPKIN (cont‘d) The honest truth? I‘d rather chew sand than go back to all that.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Then you are not angry with me? PUMPKIN exhales, blowing smoke.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about me, chickadee - I’ve got more clients than I can handle.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: You seem so at home with these Americans.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (with a sly wink) They‘re bastards. (beat) So who‘s this Colonel? Sounds like top brass.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: He has the power to approve American financing for Nobu and the Chairman.  151 152 153 154 155 114 Pumpkin slurps her soup, finishing it --

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: So is he willing to pay us American dollars? Cash? She locks at Sayuri expectantly, hunger in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Western sofas and chairs dominate the room, which is stac with liquor and cigarettes, sewing machine parts, light bulbs, samurai swords, K-rations - anything that can be s on the black-market. In a haze of tobacco smoke, a WOMAN with bobbed hair talks on the telephone. The black-market is Mother.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Don’t waste my time. You think I’m a sucker? I want sixty cases Lucky Strike or I’m taking my business to Sergeant MacPhee... KIKO (9, Auntie’s new girl) runs through, carrying towels

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN 152
dialogues.text: Sayuri‘s wet hair streams down the back of her under-kimo Sayuri scrubs her hands ruthlessly in a steaming little b of bleach and water, using a hard brush.

dialogues.speaker: KIMONO ROOM 153
dialogues.text: Sayuri digs through the stacks of black market goods pile high in the kimono room. She finds a lone dusty kimono bo and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI'S ROOM . 154
dialogues.text: With her sewing box open on the floor, Sayuri expertly se new collar onto the frayed old kimono. INT: SAYURI’'S ROOM - OKIYA. NEXT DAY. [AUTUMN] 155 Sayuri’s hair is smoothed into a modest twist. She wears newly-repaired kimono. She stares: traces of Miyako’s mos celebrated geisha, restored. Auntie (older, thinner) ties her obi. Kiko watches. Auntie finishes:  156

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE
dialogues.text: See? You are yourself again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tarmac, an U.S. transport PLANE idles. At the open hangar door a U.S. ARMY JEEP deposits Sayuri. She sees: The Chairman, standing alone, his back to her. Sayuri approaches, her heart pounding. The Chairman turns:

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN /
dialogues.text: Sayuri, just look at you. It’s as if the war never happened. His face opens in a smile. Sayuri bows, overcome.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I am so glad to see that the Chairman is safe.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Please accept my apologies, asking this of you--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: There is nothing I can do to return your kindness. But even as she speaks, a voice intrudes -

dialogues.speaker: NOBU, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Sayuri! Then she sees: The Chairman is with Nobu and Mameha (eleg in a kimono) and TWO AMERICANS - COLONEL DERRICKS (50, ca Army) is worldly, with an off-the-cuff charm that masks h baser appetites. His Lieutenant, HUTCHINS (32, West Point is considerably greener and more impressionable-- * NOBU (cont'd) * May I present Colonel Derricks. With a coy smile Sayuri bows; DERRICKS follows suit. *

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: Konichiwa. You're even more * stunning in person. My associate, * Lieutenant Hutchins. (to Hutchins) Sayuri is one of the Mysteries of the Orient I’ve told you about-~ *  116

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: A mystery that perhaps you can solve. Hutchins holds up a camera:

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: Would you mind? Sayuri’s eyes meet the Chairman's briefly. He smiles, sympathetic. The Colonel offers Sayuri his arm and a suav smile; she accepts both. Together, they pose.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: A perfect souvenir. She smiles, demurely. The camera flashes. PUMPKIN’S VOICE Who likes whiskey?? An Army Jeep has pulled up. Pumpkin jumps down with a hap squeal, wearing a colorful kimono and waving a bottle of Scotch. For her, the party’s already started.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chairman, don’t tell me you started the party without me. The propeller breeze lifts Pumpkin‘s skirts and Pumpkin g a happy shriek.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: (under his breath to Derricks) She's a live wire...

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: May I present - Pumpkin. The Lieutenant snaps a picture, to Pumpkin‘’s apparent delight. Mameha and Sayuri exchange a look, mortified for her.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Gentlemen? Nobu ushers them across the tarmac, Pumpkin pretending to pull the Chairman by the necktie, and Derricks escorting Sayuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cramped fuselage, the whir of the engines is deafening. Derricks flips down benches, and proffers seat to Sayuri:

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: Please, 'be my ‘guest-- Sayuri can't hear a word,, and looks at him helplessly. DERRICKS (cont'd) {again, above the roar)

dialogues.speaker: --HAVE A SEAT, WON'T YOU
dialogues.text: Sayuri glances toward the Chairman, hoping to sit close t him. But Pumpkin has already claimed him, pulling him dow on the opposite bench. Mameha sits on his other side. And Hutchins--his Adams apple bobbing in his throat--sidles d next to Pumpkin, clearly smitten. What can Sayuri do but respond:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (to Derricks) Thank you, I am most grateful-- He tugs on his ear; what? SAYURI (cont'd) --PERFECT. YES. Dispirited, Sayuri sinks down to find herself cramped bet Derricks and Nobu. In the din, talk is futile. The Colone smiles at her, and she offers a coquettish glance. But sh can’t help staring at the Chairman longingly, as he, Mame and Pumpkin all dissolve into giggles over a joke she can hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sayuri-~in a robe--pads through the women’s dressing area route to the natural, lagoon-like hot spring. She hears VOICES and LAUGHTER. Sayuri takes off her robe behind the wall of the dressing area, and modestly slips into the spa waters.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Don’t be shy, gentlemen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: \ ) Pumpkin gestures to the men to come and join the ladi and Mameha are already relaxing in the pools. Derricks, Hutchins, Nobu and the Chairman slide over to them. By Japanese custom, everyone is naked. A wooden tray floats, holding bottles of sake.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: Back home, a bath is nothing but a ‘ quick shower on cold tile with a bar of lye soap--

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: (with an expansive sigh) Ah, but here, you make everything a ritual, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: That is the art of turning habit into pleasure, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: Said like a true geisha! Nobu nods, but his face betrays a slight wince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we are in business together, then perhaps we will visit you some day. I‘d love to see the United States.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: Why, sure. We could teach you some of our customs. Like forks and proper chairs and what it feels like to sleep on a real mattress-—— Pumpkin bulldozes in:

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (already drunk) I know a little game we can play. It's called “Truth and Lies.”

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: I know that game, too. Back home, they call it “marriage.” Hearty male laughter all around.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: (giggling) . No! I‘m serious. Now listen closely. Sayuri knows the rules--

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: I never met a woman who didn’t! More laughter, louder from the Americans than the Japanes

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (acquiescing) Each person says two things. One is true; the other is not.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: If you guess right, the liar pays the price. - demonstrating the price: A big swallow of sake right fr the bottle. The men laugh. ” DERRICKS So it pays to lose! Laughter, louder from the Americans than the Japanese. Pumpkin tries to think of a story -

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: I go first! Now let me see...One day in Sapporo, where I was born, a fisherman caught a talking fish. Trouble is, it only spoke Russian--

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: ~ The other story is the true one, and I have not even heard it yet! Everyone laughs. Pumpkin pushes the Chairman, flirting:

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: If I drown, it’s all your fault. -- taking a big swallow of sake. She tips backward in the water and Chairman has to catch her. Sayuri and Mameha exchange a look: Pumpkin’s behavior is crossing the line.

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Your turn, Nobu-san.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: (declining to play) I am no match for these geisha; (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 NOBU (cont'd) they are experts in the art of deceit.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Sayuri, maybe. I’m an expert in one thing and one thing only: sake! Chairman floats the tray of sake over to Sayuri:

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Sayuri. The truest story you know. All eyes are on Sayuri. She gathers her courage. When she starts to speak, the timbre in the room changes; from rau to almost reverential.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Once when I was a little girl...on the banks of the Sonogawa...a handsome stranger gave me a cup of ice--ice that tasted as sweet as a mid-summer plum-- The Chairman and Mameha exchange a look. In Mameha’s eyes an implicit challenge to the Chairman: will you or will y not acknowledge the truth of Sayuri's story? The Chairman about to blush; then he interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: I think we have to stop the game. PUMPKIN giggles, very drunk. CHAIRMAN (cont‘d) If Pumpkin drinks any more sake, she will pass out.

dialogues.speaker: PUMPKIN
dialogues.text: Now that - is a true story. Everyone laughs. Sayuri looks at the Chairman, crestfalie

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRMAN
dialogues.text: Here - Mameha - Sayuri - help her. And the party starts to break up. Mameha helps the limp Pumpkin out of the pool and into her bathing kimono. As Sayuri starts to climb out of the water, Derricks corners her:

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: So...ah...what’s the protocol?  159

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: Suppose I wanted to see you. In private. Sayuri watches as the Chairman gently guides a hapless Pumpkin toward the dressing rooms; Pumpkin rests her head his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon, Colonel; that is not a geisha‘’s custom--

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: If it’s a question of price--

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: If there were a price, you could never afford it-- Nobu looks on, jealous, even as Sayuri rebukes the Colone darting under his arm and getting away --

dialogues.speaker: DERRICKS
dialogues.text: Wait--now just a‘ minute--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobu turns angrily on Sayuri -- : *

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: I saw the two of you whispering-- you have arranged some kind of tryst, haven't you—— Sayuri matches his rage with her own:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: What did you promise him? Glaring at her, he pours himself a glass of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Your company! Nothing more!

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: Be seemed to expect a great deal--!

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: If I had wanted a common whore, I could have hired one---

dialogues.speaker: SAYURT
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say--

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Just the idea of you with him--with any man--you would be dead to ne, Sayuri--- Nobu siams his glass on the table so hard it shatters. NOBU (cont’d) Can't you see that I want you for myself? Be opens his hand. In it, shards of glass. Blood creases his palm. Sayuri grabs a cloth but Nobu waves her off angrily -- NOBU {cont‘d) You have ruined me. Before we met, I was a disciplined man. He does not let her assist as he wraps his hand with clot NOBU (cont'd) I should not have asked you to come. The Chairman was against it; I should have listened to him. SAYURI stares at the floor, and says quietly:

dialogues.speaker: SAYURI
dialogues.text: (staring down) I must beg your forgiveness, Nobu- san. I was foolish to think you would barter me away.

dialogues.speaker: NOBU
dialogues.text: Then you made no arrangement with the Colonel--
